comments.commentBody:
Pretty clear by previous comments, that A LOT of people will not accept any of this info. They were willing to beat Hilary to death with anything they could find, spent a great deal of money and then came up with nothing.
If there is nothing there, then the Republicans do not have to worry about it. I personally am not thrilled about having the Russians in our computers. Even my own things have pictures of my grandkids, etc. Please understand people, we need these questions answered.
I am not sure that any of the people that talked to the Russians are every going to say what they talked about, they denied it before the senate investigation committee that they even talked to them. But if there is a trail; possibly even tapes or videos, it would be good to know about them.
Unless, one would want the Russians in all of our business; personal or corporate or government.

standing here reminded that all references to Moses and the exodus of the Israelites from pharaonic ancient Egypt were erased by the priesthood from their original state chronicles. But, somehow, we still know a lot. Even in Hollywood. So: let it be written and let it be done. In Hollywood.
Hillary, the DNC and apparently Obama were all asleep at the cybersecurity wheel.
So...this whole made up story is from Obama.  No surprise here.
"Lock her up!"   What an interesting concept.
Democrats are being given bottomless ammunition. If all this passes without a finger lifted, I will trade in my Democratic membership for a Republican one.
Next will be Trump!

replies.commentBody:
Sure, yes, absolutely. How? You can get Trump, but then you get Pence. If you manage to get Pence then you get Ryan. If for some reason Ryan is out, then you get Hatch. Then Tillerson. Mnuchin. Mattis. Sessions (Ha!). Zinke. Ross. Price. Carson (yikes almighty). DeVoss (double and triple yikes).

So be very careful what you wish for.

In the end of all this - if we survive it - we will have to bolster the constitution to delineate what happens when an election is stolen to have a mechanism that would yank out by the roots every last bit of the treasonous cancer from the executive branch. And THEN how to install a legitimate administration. Currently this is not a process that exists. We may end up finding out what it means to fight a civil war in the 21st century.

Sessions did not lie under oath to Congress. He spoke to the Russian ambassador under his authority as a Senator. Not as a surrogate for the Trump campaign, which is what Franken asked him in his confirmation hearings. He answered the question asked to him truthfully.

comments.commentBody: Fact is, Mr.Obama was totally responsible for the national security during the election. This includes fending off hacking by other nations. Am I missing something?

KEEPING IT THOUGHTFULLY HONEST: Someone had to protect us against Treason! So thank God that before President Obama's administration close its doors for business, "some White House officials scrambled to spread information about possible contacts between associates of President-elect Donald J. Trump and Russians — across the government." Meanwhile, the Russian's were attacking to undermine our presidential elections! "Former American officials say they had two aims: to ensure that such meddling isn’t duplicated in future American or European elections, and to leave a clear trail of intelligence for government investigators." Mr. Comey, just do your job!
Apparently, British and the Dutch, our European allies "provided information describing meetings in European cities between Russian officials — and others close to Russia’s president, Vladimir V. Putin — and associates of President-elect Trump." Interestingly, our allies are more concerned than McConnell and Ryan and the republicans partisans! Fortunately, 3 loyal American officials that care about our nation's interests requested anonymity in discussing classified intelligence. So who needs to be investigated? Hum.....

Attorney General Jeff Sessions committed perjury under oath regarding conversations with the Russians in response to a direct question from Senator Frankel.

President Clinton went through impeachment hearings for perjury related to marital infidelity.

So when the Attorney General perjures himself for conspiring with a foreign adversary to influence US Presidential election, he should resign and an independent Special Prosecutor should hold investigations to see which other Trump surrogate besides National Security Advisor Michael Flynn, Trump Campaign Manager Paul Manafort and Attorney General Jeff Sessions conspired with the Kremlin.

Russia has attacked western democracy in an effort to end sanctions against it for encroaching upon the sovereignty of the Ukraine.

All Americans should be outraged that Putin is attempting to destroy NATO and the western alliance that has kept the world safe from Russian aggression.

Trump has already declared the free press, protected under the US Constitution, an enemy of the people, because they are bringing the intelligence reports to the American people.

This attack against western democracy cannot stand.

"I'am not a surrogate" seems destined to take its place in history right up there with "Who has pubic hair on my coke."
- And please lets not expect Sessions to do the decent thing in this investigation, his entire career lends that thought a lie, however Sessions et al must at the minimum be required to do the legal and best thing for this country.

One observation about Mr Trump. He cannot keep from telling us what he has done. He has shot someone dead in the street in New York and still won the election. He shot and killed Lady Liberty. I mourn her.

Is there not a shred of patriotism left in the republican party that they won't arrest this man and his minions?

The GOP held congressional session after session investigating and pounding Hillary until she was so fed up and so were we all. They were constantly threatening her about her emails until we were all BLUE (or RED you could say) in the face.
Yet, I hear "rumblings" about the Russian hacking, even though that part was proven. The fact that Obama had to make sure this information was kept safe speaks volumes about what he didn't trust about our current administration.
Where are the republicans and even the democrats now up in arms? Why isn't this Treasonous investigation being put upon our current administration int the same horrific fashion it was done to Hillary? Yet Hillary's only crime was putting email in a private server, and this Russian question has far more serious allegations than that was.
The GOP and POTUS declared a witch hunt on Hillary to ruin her chances of election. It should be seriously investigated that not only did the Trump organization but also some in the GOP could have been complicit in this Russian issue.
Shameful! SAD!

March 1, 2017, mark your calendar.  This will be the date cited in the future on timelines showing the events preceding Trump's impeachment.  The surrogates (or patsies) are starting to keel over.  Hey, Bannon, Miller and Conway don't throw away any of your moving boxes because you are going to need them in the not so distant future.  My prediction for fumigation of the Oval Office: two years.

replies.commentBody:
@Michael Singer

I think the GOP members of Congress (both House and Senate) - assuming they don't rather instantaneously change their approach - will deserve their future place in history - if that ruins the GOP, that's their own fault.

If I might provide an historical comparison: Charles Lindbergh and his outright bigotry coupled with his support of Hitler and the Nazis wound-up more than offsetting his earlier achievements; we're 80 years removed from that and I'd bet any amount of money that history's verdict will never change.

On the related subject of Trump, his refusal to release his tax returns and the GOP House seemingly letting him off the hook: the release of tax returns by candidates and whoever is elected President dates back as a tradition to Nixon (his famous "I am not a crook" speech) - problem for Nixon was that he WAS a crook and would have been charged with tax evasion had he not (after his resignation) paid the IRS what he owed; it was President Ford who in one of his first acts as POTUS voluntarily released ALL of his tax returns to prove he was squeaky clean (and he was) to counter criticism that he shouldn't have pardoned Nixon.

@Michael Singer

I think the GOP members of Congress (both House and Senate) - assuming they don't rather instantaneously change their approach - will deserve their future place in history - if that ruins the GOP, that's their own fault.

If I might provide an historical comparison: Charles Lindbergh and his outright bigotry coupled with his support of Hitler and the Nazis wound-up more than offsetting his earlier achievements; we're 80 years removed from that and I'd bet any amount of money that history's verdict will never change.

On the related subject of Trump, his refusal to release his tax returns and the GOP House seemingly letting him off the hook: the release of tax returns by candidates and whoever is elected President dates back as a tradition to Nixon (his famous "I am not a crook" speech) - problem for Nixon was that he WAS a crook and would have been charged with tax evasion had he not (after his resignation) paid the IRS what he owed; it was President Ford who in one of his first acts as POTUS voluntarily released ALL of his tax returns to prove he was squeaky clean (and he was) to counter criticism that he shouldn't have pardoned Nixon.

comments.commentBody: Ever since the plank in the RNC platform last summer forbidding the US from arming the democratic government of Ukraine, evidence has been accumulating that we have indeed been dealing with a cabal of traitors, either "useful idiots," or outright Putin puppets.  Our country is at its most vulnerable point in our history.  Republicans will have to proceed with great caution, with great national devotion, lest they be branded as the party of treason, a moniker that could last for generations.  Unfortunately, it seems highly unlikely that they will come to the aid of their country.

So now we know that Trump's original campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as his recent picks for National Security Adviser and Attorney General were all meeting secretly with Russian officials during last year's presidential campaign. We also know that both Michael Flynn and Jeff Sessions lied about the full extent of their Russian contacts, with Sessions coming very close to perjuring himself in his testimony before Congress. It's also clear that the White House has enlisted congressional Republicans in an effort to derail any formal hearings or investigations. Meanwhile, Trump himself has gone strangely silent on the subject his good pal, Vladimir Putin. Looks to me as though Trump and his advisers are trying to build a legal/political firewall between the President as his Russian "connections." Let's hope they don't succeed!
Comey, Putin, & Assange elected Trump and destroyed Clinton.

Over and Over, I hear the same GOP refrain, which goes like this: "Nope, NOTHING to see here, Folks! Just mooove on, now."  Is there NO Republican in Congress willing to put 'American First, Party Second'?

replies.commentBody: Common sense from Cali. What a rare breed you are. Keep up the good work

That is the pathway to get to global governance.

Obama , do we miss him? Was he smart? was he calculating? was he the best at thinking many moves ahead? Was he so much smarter then the rest of the folks in the room? However, going against the trump group is not fair since they are so handicapped to compete with guys like Obama.

Obama, hours reviewing plans, listening to all opinions, asking key questions before approving things. Trump, making decisions between the main course and dessert at a public spot with his friends opinions. Who would you trust the fate of your son or daughter in the military to?
